article.title: Cosmological applications of the Brown-York quasilocal mass

multiple_choice_question.text:
This formula describes the line element of:

ds² = (1 + 2Φ) dt² + a²(t) (1 – 2Ψ) (dr² + r²dΩ²)
= a²(η) [ – (1 + 2Φ) dη² + (1 - 2Ψ) (dr² + r²dΩ²)]**
choices: B.  A static, spherically symmetric star
D.  A wormhole connecting two different universes

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula shows the first-order splitting of the Hawking-Hayward quasilocal mass in a perturbed FLRW universe. What does the term "ma" represent?\n\nMHH = ma + H²R³/2  ~ ma + H²R³/2ρ
choices: A. The mass of the cosmological background
B. The local Newtonian mass responsible for the metric perturbation
C. The kinetic energy of the dark matter particles
